newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Volcano spews ash in Russian Far East.
newsitem.headline: Volcano spews ash in Russian Far East.

text.p: A volcano spewed ash over a town and a village on Russia's Kamchatka peninsula, Interfax news agency said on Saturday.
It reported no injuries or damage.

Interfax said the Bezymyanny volcano had showered ash over the town of Klyuchi about 40 km (25 miles) away and over the village of Ust-Kamchatsk about 60 km (38 miles) away, leaving a thin trace of ash.
The agency quoted local vulcanologist Gennady Karpov as saying the volcano appeared to be quiet again on Saturday.
Karpov said the volcano had been showing signs of increased activity in the last two or three years and had last spewn ash in October 1995.
The Kamchatka peninsula, about 7,000 km (4,375 miles) east of Moscow), lies in a region of volcanic and seismic activity which is often hit by minor earthquakes.
